title: How to Cook Gigante Beans

steps.headline: Sort and rinse the beans.
steps.description: Pour the package (or whatever amount you’re using) of gigante beans onto a pan or towel. Sort through them and pick out any broken beans and throw out stones and/or debris. Then, rinse the beans in cold water.

steps.headline: Soak overnight.
steps.description: Put the beans into a large bowl. Cover the beans with two or three inches of cool water. Allow the beans to soak for at least eight hours or overnight. If your kitchen gets warm, store the beans in the refrigerator to avoid fermentation.

steps.headline: Rinse and drain the beans.
steps.description: Once the beans are done soaking, rinse them again in cool water. Then, drain all of the water out of the bowl. They are now ready for cooking.

steps.headline: Combine the beans and water in a large pot.
steps.description: Transfer the beans from the large bowl to a large pot on the stove. Cover the beans with about four inches of fresh water.

steps.headline: Boil the water for about three minutes.
steps.description: Then, reduce the heat. Allow the beans to simmer for 60 to 90 minutes. The beans should be tender when they are finished.

steps.headline: Serve the gigante beans.
steps.description: You can serve the beans as a side, or add them into a meal. Gigante beans pair well with chicken and seafood. They mix well with soups and marinated salads. You can store the leftover beans in the refrigerator for up to five days.

steps.headline: Soak the beans.
steps.description: Put the beans in a large bowl. Cover the beans in water. Soak the beans for about eight hours.

steps.headline: Drain and rinse the beans.
steps.description: Once the beans are finished soaking, drain all of the water from the bowl. Then, rinse the beans off in cold water.

steps.headline: Put the ingredients in a slow cooker.
steps.description: Add the beans into the slow cooker. Then, add the rest of the ingredients (tomatoes, celery, onion, and garlic) in with the beans. Stir the ingredients until they mix together. Cover the ingredients with water.

steps.headline: Cook for eight to ten hours.
steps.description: Cover the lid of the slow cooker and cook the ingredients for 8 to 10 hours on a low setting. The beans should be soft when they are done cooking. Season the ingredients with one tablespoon of salt when they are finished cooking.

steps.headline: Serve the beans.
steps.description: The temperature at which you serve them is a matter of preference. You can serve the dish cold, room temperature, or hot. For a traditional Greek-style meal, serve the dish with crusty bread and white wine. Store the leftovers in the refrigerator and eat them within a few days.

steps.headline: Soak overnight.
steps.description: Put the beans into a large pot. Cover the beans in two or three inches of cool water. Allow the beans to soak overnight. Drain all of the water from the bowl when they are done soaking. Rinse the soaked beans in cool water.

steps.headline: Put the beans in a large pot.
steps.description: Put the beans in a heavy bottom pot. Cover the beans in cold water. The water should rise two inches above the beans.

steps.headline: Add the garlic and herbs .
steps.description: Put the garlic, herbs, and bay leaf into the heavy bottom pot. Stir the ingredients so that they mix with the beans.

steps.headline: Cook for 90 minutes to two hours.
steps.description: Bring the water to a boil. Then, reduce the heat and allow it to simmer for 90 minutes to 2 hours. The beans should be tender when they are finished.

steps.headline: Add the kale.
steps.description: Put the chopped kale into the pot. Allow to simmer for five minutes. After that, drain the excess water.

steps.headline: Add seasoning.
steps.description: Put the salt, pepper, olive oil, soy sauce, and lemon juice into the pot. Stir all of the ingredients together. Sprinkle the meal with extra virgin olive oil before serving warm.

text: Preparing Basic Gigante Beans Sort and rinse the beans. Pour the package (or whatever amount you’re using) of gigante beans onto a pan or towel. Sort through them and pick out any broken beans and throw out stones and/or debris. Then, rinse the beans in cold water. Soak overnight. Put the beans into a large bowl. Cover the beans with two or three inches of cool water. Allow the beans to soak for at least eight hours or overnight. If your kitchen gets warm, store the beans in the refrigerator to avoid fermentation. Rinse and drain the beans. Once the beans are done soaking, rinse them again in cool water. Then, drain all of the water out of the bowl. They are now ready for cooking. Combine the beans and water in a large pot. Transfer the beans from the large bowl to a large pot on the stove. Cover the beans with about four inches of fresh water. Boil the water for about three minutes. Then, reduce the heat. Allow the beans to simmer for 60 to 90 minutes. The beans should be tender when they are finished. Serve the gigante beans. You can serve the beans as a side, or add them into a meal. Gigante beans pair well with chicken and seafood. They mix well with soups and marinated salads. You can store the leftover beans in the refrigerator for up to five days. Cooking Greek-Style Gigante Beans Soak the beans. Put the beans in a large bowl. Cover the beans in water. Soak the beans for about eight hours. Drain and rinse the beans. Once the beans are finished soaking, drain all of the water from the bowl. Then, rinse the beans off in cold water. Put the ingredients in a slow cooker. Add the beans into the slow cooker. Then, add the rest of the ingredients (tomatoes, celery, onion, and garlic) in with the beans. Stir the ingredients until they mix together. Cover the ingredients with water. Cook for eight to ten hours. Cover the lid of the slow cooker and cook the ingredients for 8 to 10 hours on a low setting. The beans should be soft when they are done cooking. Season the ingredients with one tablespoon of salt when they are finished cooking. Serve the beans. The temperature at which you serve them is a matter of preference. You can serve the dish cold, room temperature, or hot. For a traditional Greek-style meal, serve the dish with crusty bread and white wine. Store the leftovers in the refrigerator and eat them within a few days. Making Gigante Beans with Kale Soak overnight. Put the beans into a large pot. Cover the beans in two or three inches of cool water. Allow the beans to soak overnight. Drain all of the water from the bowl when they are done soaking. Rinse the soaked beans in cool water. Put the beans in a large pot. Put the beans in a heavy bottom pot. Cover the beans in cold water. The water should rise two inches above the beans. Add the garlic and herbs . Put the garlic, herbs, and bay leaf into the heavy bottom pot. Stir the ingredients so that they mix with the beans. Cook for 90 minutes to two hours. Bring the water to a boil. Then, reduce the heat and allow it to simmer for 90 minutes to 2 hours. The beans should be tender when they are finished. Add the kale. Put the chopped kale into the pot. Allow to simmer for five minutes. After that, drain the excess water. Add seasoning. Put the salt, pepper, olive oil, soy sauce, and lemon juice into the pot. Stir all of the ingredients together. Sprinkle the meal with extra virgin olive oil before serving warm.
